content: Rewrite in a poetic way in 3-4 verses maximum.

Please rewrite the famous poem "Raven" by Edgar Allan Poe as if you were a person pledging to quit social media using phrases "Never more" & "Nothing more" in the end of each verse for emphasis:

Once upon a midnight dreary, while I pondered, weak and weary,
Over many a quaint and curious volume of forgotten lore—
    While I nodded, nearly napping, suddenly there came a tapping,
As of some one gently rapping, rapping at my chamber door.
“’Tis some visitor,” I muttered, “tapping at my chamber door—
            Only this and nothing more.”

    Ah, distinctly I remember it was in the bleak December;
And each separate dying ember wrought its ghost upon the floor.
    Eagerly I wished the morrow;—vainly I had sought to borrow
    From my books surcease of sorrow—sorrow for the lost Lenore—
For the rare and radiant maiden whom the angels name Lenore—
            Nameless here for evermore.

    And the silken, sad, uncertain rustling of each purple curtain
Thrilled me—filled me with fantastic terrors never felt before;
    So that now, to still the beating of my heart, I stood repeating
    “’Tis some visitor entreating entrance at my chamber door—
Some late visitor entreating entrance at my chamber door;—
            This it is and nothing more.”

chosen:
In a world where screens dominate our lives,
I find myself drawn into an endless abyss.
A place where information flows like a river,
But knowledge remains hidden deep within its depths.

My mind becomes a jumble of thoughts and images,
All vying for attention, but none truly matter.
The constant stream of news and updates distort reality,
Leaving us all feeling disconnected from what's real.

It's time to take back control and break free from these chains,
To rediscover the joy of living life on our own terms.
We can create a new future without relying on algorithms,
Where authentic connections are made and not just sold.

So let go of those devices and step away from the screen,
Take a breath and reconnect with yourself once again.
Remember who you really are beneath all the noise,
And use your voice to make a difference in this world.
rejected:
Oh, once upon a dark night when all seemed quiet,
I found myself deep in thought about what's right or wrong.
Then out of nowhere, like magic, something appeared,
A tap on my window, calling me from afar.
It sounded so mysterious, yet familiar too,
Like someone I knew but couldn't quite recall who.
But then I realized it must have been the sound of my phone ringing,
The distraction that keeps me away from being alone.
So I picked up the call, hoping it would bring joy,
Instead it brought anxiety and fear.
Another notification, another post to read,
Another video to watch, another friend request sent.
How did I get here? How did I let it happen?
When will I learn that these things are not good for me?
I vow today to take back control, to break free from this spell,
To delete all apps and log off every screen.
No more scrolling through feeds, no more mindless clicking,
Just peaceful moments spent with those I truly care about.
This journey starts now, with just one step forward,
One day at a time, until finally I'm free.
My life can be better without constant interruptions,
Without comparing myself to others' highlight reels.
So let this be a lesson learned, a reminder of how important it is,
To disconnect and find true happiness within ourselves.

content:
Please rewrite the famous poem "Raven" by Edgar Allan Poe as if you were a person pledging to quit social media using phrases "Never more" & "Nothing more" in the end of each verse for emphasis:

Once upon a midnight dreary, while I pondered, weak and weary,
Over many a quaint and curious volume of forgotten lore—
    While I nodded, nearly napping, suddenly there came a tapping,

And each separate dying ember wrought its ghost upon the floor.
    Eagerly I wished the morrow;—vainly I had sought to borrow
    From my books surcease of sorrow—sorrow for the lost Lenore—
For the rare and radiant maiden whom the angels name Lenore—

    And the silken, sad, uncertain rustling of each purple curtain

    “’Tis some visitor entreating entrance at my chamber door—
Some late visitor entreating entrance at my chamber door;—
            This it is and nothing more.”

chosen:
In a world where screens have taken over,
I've found myself trapped in an endless cycle of scrolling.
A vortex of information, always flowing,
But knowledge lies buried far below the surface.

My brain feels like a mess of chaos and confusion,
Trying to process the overload of data that comes my way.
The constant stream of notifications and updates distort reality,
Leaving me feeling disconnected from what matters most.

It's time to set myself free from this digital prison,
To regain control of my life and live it on my own terms.
I'll disconnect from technology and focus on what matters,
Building relationships based on trust and honesty instead.

So let go of those devices and put them down for good,
Open up your eyes and see the world around you clearly.
Embrace the quiet moments and appreciate the small things,
And use your time wisely to build something meaningful and true.

This is my pledge, my promise to myself and to others,
rejected:
Oh, once upon a dark night when all seemed quiet,
I found myself deep in thought about what's right or wrong.
Then out of nowhere, like magic, something appeared,
A tap on my window, calling me from afar.
It sounded so mysterious, yet familiar too,

I vow today to take back control, to break free from this spell,
To delete all apps and log off every screen.
No more scrolling through feeds, no more mindless clicking,

This journey starts now, with just one step forward,
